entry.title: Notes for CS229
entry.content:
Notes for CS229

my notes for online machine learning course from Stanford

Lecture 1 Course Overview

Main topics of this class:

  • supervised learning: learn from being given “right answers”
    • regression:
      • value to predict is continuous (can be any value in a range)
      • predict a number from infinitely many possible outputs
    • classification
      • value to predict is discrete (E.g.: 0 or 1 )
      • predict categories from small number of possible outputs
  • unsupervised learning: find something interesting in unlabeled data
    • clustering: take data without labels and try to automatically group them into clusters
    • anomaly detection: find unusual data points
    • dimensionality reduction: compress data using fewer numbers
  • systematic learning strategy
  • deep learning
  • reinforcement learning

Lecture 2 Linear Regression and Gradient Descent

graph TDA[training set]B[learning algorithm]C[hypothesis]A --> B --> C
graph LRC[hypothesis]D[input parameters]    E[estimated output]D --> C --> E
